ADD RECOMMENDATIONS

When the batteries (cell, module or pack) are stored, the following safety aspects need to be taken into consideration

  • To avoid deterioration of the performance and/or surface corrosion due to high temperature or humidity, the batteries need to be stored in well ventilated, dry and cool conditions.
  • The battery cartons may not be stacked higher than specified by the manufacturer. The batteries in the lowest carton may be deformed and leakage may occur due to the weight.
  • Donâ€™t store or display batteries in direct sun or places where they get exposed to rain. The storage should be a controlled environment.
  • Use only original packages for the battery storage. When batteries are unpacked and mixed they may be short-circuited or damaged.
  • To detect an early temperature increase in a battery (which can lead to a thermal runaway) the temperature of a stored components need to be checked regularly
  • When damaged components are stored, extra awareness and monitoring is needed. In these cases the probability on a thermal runaway, increases.
